Incorrect answer.
Settings
1. #define is known as preprocessor compiler directive.
2. The ++ operator increments the operand by 1, whereas, the -- operator decrements it by 1.
3. Only character or integer can be used in switch statement.
4. A zero value is considered to be false and a non-zero value is considered to be true.
5. Blank spaces may be inserted between two words to improve the readability of the statement.
6. The keywords cannot be used as variable names.
7. Switch statement can have any number of case instances.
8. Two case constants within the same switch statement can have the same value.
9. A do-while loop is used to ensure that the statements within the loop are executed at least twice..
10. = is used for comparison, whereas, == is used for assignment of two quantities.
1. In an instance method or a constructor, "this" is a reference to the current object.
2. Garbage Collection is manual process.
3. The JRE deletes objects when it determines that they are no longer being used. This process is called Garbage Collection.
4. Constructor overloading is not possible in Java.
5. Assignment operator is evaluated Left to Right.
6. All binary operators except for the assignment operators are evaluated from Left to Right.
7. Java programming is not statically-typed, means all variables should not first be declared before they can be used.
8. In Java SE 7 and later, underscore characters "_" can appear anywhere between digits in a numerical literal
9. Variable name can begin with a letter, "$", or "_".
10. Interfaces can be instantiated.
1. It is not possible to achieve inheritance of structures in c++?
2. Super classes are also called Parent classes/Base classes.
3. Sub classes may also be called Child classes/Derived classes.
4. The cin input statement is used to receive data from keyboard.
5. The cout output statement is used to print text on the screen.
6. Each C++ program may have many main function.
7. A comment in C++ langauge starts with */ and ends with /*
8. Programmers use a variety of special languages, called programming languages, to communicate with the computer.
9. The assembly languages represent the only way to communicate directly with the computer.
10. When writing a procedure-oriented program, the programmer concentrates on the major tasks that the program needs to perform.
Are you sure you want to do this?
